arStrings.szText: {icon:Vampire_Pact_Green_Icon, 2.0} {c_highlight}Pacts of Divinity{/c} are most often found on {c_highlight}Helms{/c}.
{icon:Vampire_Pact_Red_Icon, 2.0} {c_highlight}Pacts of Ferocity{/c} are most often found on {c_highlight}Gloves{/c} and {c_highlight}Boots{/c}.

The maximum number of {c_highlight}Pacts{/c} on an item differs per slot. This is {c_number}3{/c} on {c_highlight}Helm{/c} and {c_highlight}Boots{/c}, {c_number}4{/c} on {c_highlight}Pants{/c}, and {c_number}5{/c} on {c_highlight}Chest Armor{/c} and {c_highlight}Gloves{/c}.
{c_highlight}Pacts{/c} are only found on {c_highlight}Armor{/c}, rather than {c_highlight}Weapons{/c} or {c_highlight}Jewelry{/c}.
Standalone {c_highlight}Pacts{/c} found in {icon:season, 2.0} {c_highlight}Season of Blood{/c} content can be manually added to {c_highlight}Armor{/c} pieces.

{c_highlight}Pacts{/c} can be removed from {c_highlight}Pact Armor{/c} with {c_highlight}Cleansing Acid{/c}. {c_highlight}Cleansing Acid{/c} can be altered at the {icon:Marker_Crafter_Alchemist, 2.0} {c_highlight}Alchemist{/c} to remove only specific {c_highlight}Pacts{/c}.
{c_highlight}Vampire Coffins{/c} are a reliable source of {c_highlight}Potent Blood{/c} and {c_highlight}Pact{/c}-related items.
Leftover {c_highlight}Potent Blood{/c} can be used at the {icon:Marker_Crafter_Alchemist, 2.0} {c_highlight}Alchemist{/c} to craft {c_highlight}Pact{/c}-altering {c_highlight}Consumables{/c}.
Special {c_highlight}Vampiric Powers{/c} can be unlocked from the {icon:Quest_Season_Progress, 2.0} {c_highlight}Seasonal Quest{/c} and {icon:Marker_SME_Vamptide, 2.0} {c_highlight}Blood Harvest{/c}.
{c_highlight}Vampiric Powers{/c} can be upgraded by consuming {c_highlight}Potent Blood{/c} in the {icon:VampireCircleTabIcon, 2.0} {c_highlight}Seasonal tab of your inventory{/c}.
Only {c_number}five{/c} {c_highlight}Vampiric Powers{/c} can be equipped at a time.
{c_highlight}Vampiric Powers{/c} all draw from the same total of your equipped armor's {c_highlight}Pacts{/c}.

Increasing your {icon:Marker_Board_Vampire, 2.0} {c_highlight}Hunter's Acclaim{/c} within {icon:Marker_SME_Vamptide, 2.0} {c_highlight}Blood Harvest{/c} provides many kinds of rewards, including equipment, materials, and {c_highlight}Vampiric Powers{/c}.
The {c_highlight}Season Journey{/c} can be found in the {c_highlight}Seasons{/c} tab in the {c_highlight}Menu{/c}.
Follow the {icon:Quest_Season_Progress, 2.0}{c_highlight}Seasonal Quest mark{/c} on the Map or in the Journal to explore Seasonal content.

{c_highlight}Seasonal items{/c} only last the current season. Seasonal characters will be moved to the {c_highlight}Eternal realm{/c} when the current season ends. {c_highlight}Pacts{/c} will be removed from your {c_highlight}Armor{/c}, but you will keep all of your gear and currency.
{icon:Vampire_Pact_Purple_Icon, 2.0} {c_highlight}Pacts of Eternity{/c} are most often found on {c_highlight}Chest Armor{/c} and {c_highlight}Pants{/c}.
Most {c_highlight}Vampiric Powers{/c} can only be unlocked when consuming {c_highlight}Potent Blood{/c} in the {icon:VampireCircleTabIcon, 2.0} {c_highlight}Seasonal tab of your inventory{/c}.

If any new {c_highlight}Vampiric Powers{/c} are available, at least one will be an option to unlock when consuming {c_highlight}Potent Blood{/c} in the {icon:VampireCircleTabIcon, 2.0} {c_highlight}Seasonal tab of your inventory{/c}.
{c_highlight}Armor Pacts{/c} don't offer any combat bonuses on their own, but they can activate the {c_highlight}Vampiric Powers{/c} you equip.
